intro: Pilosella portae, commonly known as the Alpine Mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It produces numerous tiny flowers that develop into small, dry fruits called achenes. Pilosella portae is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes at high altitudes.
